About Me

Hi, I'm Zoe. I'm currently a UWE Games Technology student in Bristol, England. Here you can see some of my personal and university projects that I have worked on. I have a strong determination and perserverance many challenges but especially with programming tasks, which sometimes leads me to madness but also means that I'm constantly evolving and improving my projects.

I managed to teach myself HTML (something I've always wanted to learn) in order to create this website and while simple, I'm very proud of it. Please take a look around and if you have any questions or would like to get in contact feel free :)

Most of the C++ Projects on this website use an OpenGL Game Framework provided by a year 1 module leader which provides basic window and sprite functionality. All collisions, physics, movement and UI has been implemented by me.

Student Projects

Angry Birds

  • C++
  • Uni Year 1
  • Coursework
  • Gamedev

An Angry Birds recreation made as my second piece of coursework in a year 1 module. My additions to this project above the specification include the use of structures and a basic (and very buggy) physics simulation built from scratch, all in C++.

Ping

  • C++
  • Uni Year 1
  • Coursework
  • Gamedev

A ping-pong game created as my first piece of coursework in a year 1 module. My additions to this project above the specification include AI and a 'hard mode' where objects obstruct the ball.

Space Invaders

  • C++
  • Uni Year 1
  • Gamedev

A basic alien shooting game made during tutorials in my first semester, made to help understanding of the OpenGL Game Framework provided by my module leader. I have expanded on this project by ....

Breakout

  • C++
  • Uni Year 1
  • 1st C++ Project
  • Gamedev

A breakout style game created in tutorials as my first ever game project in C++. All code created in C++ with help from an OpenGL Game Framework.

Personal Projects

Fishy

  • C++
  • Personal Project
  • Gamedev

In order to extend my knowledge of the Game Framework given to me, I created this small fish game where you have to avoid obstacles and eat food to get bigger and gain points.

Stumble Home

  • Unity
  • C#
  • Global Game Jam 2019
  • Gamedev

My submission for the 2019 Global Game Jam. I worked in a small team, where I worked on the majority code of the game while others worked on the art, audio and gameplay design.
